2M3.1.title: Gathering or Transmitting National Defense Information to Aid a Foreign

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this an offense under 18 U.S.C. §§ 2155, 2156, 42 U.S.C. § 2284, or 49 U.S.C. § 60123?

yesResult.description: Destruction of, or production of defective, war material, war premises, or war utilities

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply to this offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve top secret information?

noResult.description: Non-top secret national defense information was lost

2M4.1.title: Failure to Register and Evasion of Military Service

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the person who disclosed the information have or previously have authorized access to classified information identifying a covert agent?

yesResult.description: Information disclosed by person with authorized access to classified information identifying a covert agent

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the person who disclosed the information have authorized access only to other classified information (not identifying a covert agent)?

yesResult.description: Information disclosed by person with authorized access only to other classified information

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - refer to §2X5.1 (Other Offenses)

2M5.1.title: Evasion of Export Controls; Financial Transactions with Countries Supporting

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Were national security controls or controls relating to the proliferation of nuclear, biological, or chemical weapons or materials evaded?

yesResult.description: National security or WMD proliferation controls evaded

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve a financial transaction with a country supporting international terrorism (as designated under section 1754 of the Export Controls Act of 2018)?

yesResult.description: Financial transaction with country supporting international terrorism

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense occur at a time when persons were being inducted for compulsory military service?

yesEffect.description: Offense occurred during compulsory military service induction period

2M5.3.title: Providing Material Support or Resources to Designated Foreign Terrorist

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve only non-fully automatic small arms (rifles, handguns, or shotguns) with 2 or fewer weapons?
Did the offense involve only ammunition for non-fully automatic small arms with 500 or fewer rounds?

yesResult.description: Non-fully automatic small arms (≤2 weapons) and/or ammunition (≤500 rounds)

noResult.description: Non-fully automatic small arms (≤2 weapons) and/or ammunition (≤500 rounds)

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve only ammunition for non-fully automatic small arms with 500 or fewer rounds?

yesResult.description: Non-fully automatic small arms (≤2 weapons) and/or ammunition (≤500 rounds)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the provision of dangerous weapons, firearms, explosives, funds to purchase such items, or funds/material support for violent acts?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved provision of dangerous weapons, firearms, explosives, funds to purchase such items, or funds/material support with intent, knowledge, or reason to believe they would be used for violent acts

2M6.1.title: Unlawful Activity Involving Nuclear Material, Weapons, or Facilities,

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the offense committed with intent to injure the United States?

yesResult.description: Intent to injure the United States

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the offense committed with intent to aid a foreign nation or a foreign terrorist organization?

yesResult.description: Intent to aid foreign nation or foreign terrorist organization

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 175b?
Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 175?

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve a threat to use, or otherwise involve select biological agents, listed precursors/toxic chemicals, nuclear material, or weapons of mass destruction containing these materials?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Applies only if subsection (a)(2) or (a)(4)(A) applies

yesEffect.description: Offense involved select biological agent, listed precursor/toxic chemical, nuclear material, or WMD containing these materials

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the extent of victim injury?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Applies only if subsection (a)(2), (a)(3), or (a)(4)(A) applies

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense result in substantial disruption of public/governmental/business functions or substantial expenditure for cleanup/decontamination/response?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Applies only if subsection (a)(2), (a)(3), or (a)(4) applies

yesEffect.description: Offense resulted in substantial disruption or substantial cleanup/response expenditure

2M6.2.title: Violation of Other Federal Atomic Energy Agency Statutes, Rules, and

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the offense committed with intent to injure the United States or to aid a foreign nation?

yesResult.description: Offense committed with intent to injure the United States or aid a foreign nation

noResult.description: Nuclear energy offense without intent to injure the United States or aid a foreign nation
